channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- Dell OpenManage Enterprise
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- Dell OpenManage Enterprise

item.title: CVE-2021-21584|2024-09-17T02:52:25.417Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise version 3.5 and OpenManage Enterprise-Modular version 1.30.00 contain an information disclosure vulnerability. An authenticated low privileged attacker may potentially exploit this vulnerability leading to disclosure of the OIDC server credentials.

item.title: CVE-2021-21596|2024-09-17T03:29:07.090Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise versions 3.4 through 3.6.1 and Dell OpenManage Enterprise Modular versions 1.20.00 through 1.30.00, contain a remote code execution vulnerability. A malicious attacker with access to the immediate subnet may potentially exploit this vulnerability leading to information disclosure and a possible elevation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2021-21564|2024-09-17T03:12:40.744Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise versions prior to 3.6.1 contain an improper authentication vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker may potentially exploit this vulnerability to hijack an elevated session or perform unauthorized actions by sending malformed data.

item.title: CVE-2020-5321|2024-09-17T03:54:22.407Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell EMC OpenManage Enterprise (OME) versions prior to 3.2 and OpenManage Enterprise-Modular (OME-M) versions prior to 1.10.00 contain an improper input validation vulnerability. A remote authenticated malicious user with high privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability to spawn tasks with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-28979|2024-08-20T16:33:25.303Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions 4.1.0 and older, contains an Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability. A high privileged attacker with remote access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Script injection.

item.title: CVE-2024-28961|2024-06-04T18:03:39.929Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions 4.0.0 and 4.0.1, contains a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability. A local low privileged malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability to obtain credentials leading to unauthorized access with elevated privileges. This could lead to further attacks, thus Dell recommends customers to upgrade at the earliest opportunity.

item.title: CVE-2024-28978|2024-06-04T18:03:29.023Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions 3.10 and 4.0, contains an Improper Access Control vulnerability. A high privileged remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to unauthorized access to resources.

item.title: CVE-2024-28979|2024-06-04T18:03:22.391Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions prior to 4.1.0, contains an XSS injection vulnerability in UI. A high privileged local attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to JavaScript injection.

item.title: CVE-2024-25944|2024-03-29T16:30:00.128Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, v4.0 and prior, contain(s) a path traversal vulnerability. An unauthenticated remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, to gain unauthorized access to the files stored on the server filesystem, with the privileges of the running web application.

item.title: CVE-2024-28979|2024-08-02T01:03:51.273Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions prior to 4.1.0, contains an XSS injection vulnerability in UI. A high privileged local attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to JavaScript injection.

item.title: CVE-2024-28961|2024-08-02T01:03:51.473Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions 4.0.0 and 4.0.1, contains a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability. A local low privileged malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability to obtain credentials leading to unauthorized access with elevated privileges. This could lead to further attacks, thus Dell recommends customers to upgrade at the earliest opportunity.

item.title: CVE-2024-28978|2024-08-02T01:03:51.449Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, versions 3.10 and 4.0, contains an Improper Access Control vulnerability. A high privileged remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to unauthorized access to resources.

item.title: CVE-2024-25944|2024-09-04T15:07:16.959Z -- dell -- dell%20openmanage%20enterprise
item.description: Dell OpenManage Enterprise, v4.0 and prior, contain(s) a path traversal vulnerability. An unauthenticated remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, to gain unauthorized access to the files stored on the server filesystem, with the privileges of the running web application.
